website_summaries.verdict: A reasonably priced set that makes a generous number of funky, colorful braided bracelets. Especially well-received by tweens and makes a novel slumber party project that will keep kids entertained for hours.
pros: With four looms and enough embroidery floss and beads to make up to 22 bracelets, this set is ideal for get-togethers
Plenty of patterns and colors inspire creativity and allow kids to craft their own unique friendship bracelets
Sturdy and attractive carry case is ideal for gifting or on-the-go crafting
cons: Takes a bit of time and patience to create a masterpiece
Younger kids may not be able to join in the fun

customer_reviews.title: For anyone who is wanting an easy kit to make bracelets
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who is wanting an easy kit to make bracelets, this is not the one! It comes with a TON of string however it is so complicated that I can't even use it the way the instructions say to. I am literally 22 years old and I spent over 30 minutes just trying to understand the instructions and measuring and cutting string that I was over it. I actually tried more than once and had other people try to understand it and do it and it was just more trouble than it was worth. I am really curious how children are supposed to be able to do this.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrating. Metallic string unravels easily.
customer_reviews.text: My mom purchased this bracelet kit for me this Christmas. I was excited to make my first bracelet and spent most of Christmas day trying. I attempted to make a bracelet for several hours, but was unsuccessful and asked my dad for help. He found the directions confusing, so we looked online for a video. He started weaving it, but also found it very frustrating. The colors are beautiful, but the gold and silver string unravels easily making it impossible to weave. This kit was very frustrating. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Raising Thinkers

customer_reviews.title: Okay, I feel ridiculous trying to help my daughter ...
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I feel ridiculous trying to help my daughter with this toy. I learned how to make friendship bracelets as a child and thought this would help my soon-to-be 8 year old learn too, but the foam holders just made things more confusing. The string required about 2 full colors to make 1 bracelet - I plan on buying her replacement floss at a craft store if she ever picks this up again. It's a cute set, but definitely requires some patience.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for crafty girls
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this gift for my almost 8 year old daughter but ended up using it as a last minute birthday gift for her friend. It was the gift that got the highest excitement reaction! The foam bracelet makers are easy for little hands to hold and make it easy for them to follow the directions to make their own one of a kind bracelets. This is a great and unique gift idea for any little girl.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G

customer_reviews.title: Great craft for a group!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my niece who was at camp. I saw that rain was on the forecast on the Wednesday of her week long stay. I sent it up and she, of course had to sing for her package. Hehehe. There was enough string for everyone in her cabin to participate & have fun. The girls all made great memories just hanging out in their cabin, making bracelets.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Not the easiest item to assemble
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nine-year-old and 11-year-old to play with during quarantine. It was a little more difficult to use the little foam guideline starters I even had an issue using them however we were able to look online and figure out how to make them without the little foam pieces. We were able to use all of the string and the beads. The only string that doesn’t work very well is the metallic and gold strings because they fall apart very easily. If you didn’t have to help your own kid duties then they’re perfect for gifting.
customer_reviews.author: Lchris

customer_reviews.title: Calming and creative activity
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loves this set as we are trying to find creative things during quarantine. I am looking forward to ordering this again for gift ideas for my daughter's friends as it comes packaged so nicely and is easy to use. I did have to get my daughter started on the pattern of each circle and square loom but once I taught her she got the hang of it. She is 8 years old and is having a fun time creating friendship bracelets with a lot of our free time.
customer_reviews.author: Mom_of_Lil1

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 9 year old daughter. I helped her figure it out because the patterns are difficult to decipher immediately but once we figured it out she whipped through it so she could wear the one she made to school the next day. It takes some time to understand the patterns and some time to make the bracelet, but that's the point. Great way to keep crafty kids busy on a rainy day.
customer_reviews.author: David Luaces

customer_reviews.title: Makes nice friendship bracelets
customer_reviews.text: We got this to stay entertained during quarantine. The set comes with a nice selection of thread and embellishments. The instructions are easier to understand when you look at the videos that are on their website. I didn’t give it 5 stars because the foam shapes are a bit bulky to handle and the markings rub off rather easily.
customer_reviews.author: Aztomi

customer_reviews.title: Not for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Loved the little loom inside and instructions are given but this is very difficult for an 8 year old. Probably should say 10 and up
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: This brand is not cheap but packaging looked cheap. The activities shown were difficult even for older teens. Instructions could be explained better. Colorful though.
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: So much was included in this set. You are able to make a variety of bracelets. I was looking for something to keep my girls busy this summer. I even made a few bracelets for them. The instructions are good but there are also videos online from Alex that are great to watch to make sure you are making them correctly.
customer_reviews.author: momof6

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 for 2 different birthday presents and received 2 different packagings, but contents the same. Appears to be decent sets and offers lots of options. Now my kid wants one so I will be buying another one. Looks like it should work for the 7-10 years of age, certainly older kids or adults if into crafts.
customer_reviews.author: JBP

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: Makes a great gift for any young kid. My 12 yr old niece had a fun time making her friends a bracelet during a sleepover. It's a great activity for a rainy day & gets them away from any electronic device. It was easy for to use & set up. Straight forward.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: My daughter and her friends love this kit
customer_reviews.text: My daughter and her friends love this kit. The carrying case is nice to store everything in and the embroidery floss comes in lots of colors. I would recommend that you go on YouTube to find some videos demonstrating how to make the bracelets and how to use the looms because it may be a little difficult if you have never made them before. Great kit with everything you need to make over 20 bracelets!
customer_reviews.author: Balanced Life

customer_reviews.title: Not clear instructions at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a craft to do with the children I work with and the instructions were so unclear that I haven't had time to sit down but myself and figure them out so that we can actually use it. So really this has been a totally useless purchase for me unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: watergirl

customer_reviews.title: Un happy
customer_reviews.text: It’s a super cute set but neither my 10 year old or I could figure this out. We watched all the videos and tried so hard to follow them step by step but it was ridiculous. We tried multiple times and even tried the easiest one and still no success.
customer_reviews.author: Taly Gatewood

customer_reviews.title: Great price for this kit
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this kit. My daughters are in their late teens but I don't think you outgrow making adorable bracelets. They love it!
customer_reviews.author: BusyReading

customer_reviews.title: Craft
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 10 year old grand daughter. She's had loads of fun with this.
customer_reviews.author: Gerri Hall

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful bracelets...watch the videos to make.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my daughter. It makes beautiful bracelets. I would recommend just watching the videos on YouTube instead of reading the directions. The round bracelets can be made a lot faster than the flat one. Tip...if you want to use the gold and silver string then tie that string at both ends before using so it doesn't come undone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cute carrying case
customer_reviews.text: What I liked the most about this kit was that it came with a cute carrying case. My daughter has a lot of craft items and different kits, and we have to buy different sized containers to keep them organized. This not only has its own case, but it is easily portable and she can take it with her when she hangs with her friends or visits grandma. This also makes a great donation gift for displaced youth, foster kids or kids in a shelter.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Fun concept, hard execution.
customer_reviews.text: This is super complicated for first time users, and honestly, it requires a lot of advisement and practice on a parents part. Ultimately, I'll be looking for an easier activity before trying to teach this one to my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Paranormal Bree

customer_reviews.title: Inferior Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 9 year old granddaughter for Christmas. I feel that the printed instructions could be made clearer. We watched the video on YouTube several times. I have experience making bracelets working with pre waxed, braided cord and seed beads. We somehow lost the (pencil) opening to pass the finished end through. For the most part we got the hang of it and had a pretty decent first bracelet. She is left-handed and about halfway through I wondered if it would have been easier for her if we had reversed the process. The instructions show you holding the circle with your left hand and positioning the threads with your right hand moving it counter-clockwise.
customer_reviews.author: GKSFL

customer_reviews.title: It is also hard for me to make it but the bracelets come out pretty. It took me about an hour to make ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 4 yrs old daughter. It is hard for her to make the bracelet. It is also hard for me to make it but the bracelets come out pretty. It took me about an hour to make one. The instruction was not hard for me to understand. It tells you step by step. If it gets confusing you can look it up on youtube. My son also made one for himself.
customer_reviews.author: mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Bad instructions
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are laughable. You’re better off buying the yarn and beads and doing your own thing. The only reason this got two starts is because the colors were pretty and the case is good. Other than that, this is a waste. No 9-13 year old, let alone adult, could figure out the instructions unless they’ve done this before or follow a video tutorial about a doZen times.
customer_reviews.author: Bval

customer_reviews.title: The kit offered an instuctional video
customer_reviews.text: Gave to 11yr old "crafty" grand daughter. She is home from school and loved the diversion. It offered a site to go to online to teach you how to use the handheld looms. She made a bracelet in 1 and 1/2 days and loved it. Very Boho chic colors and beads. She is already choosing colors for the next one. Big Hit.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Nana

customer_reviews.title: Girly Fun
customer_reviews.text: A super cool gift. Very easy to follow instructions and you can buy any embroidery thread for them to make lots of cool bracelets
customer_reviews.author: Sandy McKeehan

customer_reviews.title: Granddaughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my 9 year old granddaughter. She loved it! Easy to use and lots of pretty strings to make bracelets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bracelet kit
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (12) likes it. She had to have a friend show her how to make the bracelets as she was unable to follow the directions.
customer_reviews.author: Kori

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Daughters said it was too hard to make a bracelet. Daughters didn’t play with it after opening it. Was going to try to help them but the had stuff everywhere and I couldn’t find the directions after Would not buy again
customer_reviews.author: suber

customer_reviews.title: difficult to start
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old. It was a bit difficult to start and the directions are not that great. Spent too much time trying to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Dina Stout

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: The kids and friends had a great time making each other bracelets.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gifts
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for gifts for migrant children so I don't how they went over.
customer_reviews.author: Sara34232

customer_reviews.title: Well Put Together Kit with Extended Play Potential
customer_reviews.text: I bought this kit and the Dylan's Arm Candy bracelet kit for a mature 8 year old who loves to braid things. The Arm Candy kit was an instant hit - easy to start in with right away and make something in a few minutes time. This kit is more involved and would require some adult or older sibling/friend assistance to get going - this is a great rainy or snowy day kit and more than one child/adult can work on it together. This is a really well presented kit that with a bit of supervision and a child who has an attention span more than just a few minutes will enjoy very much.
customer_reviews.author: Muir Beach

customer_reviews.title: too complex and time consuming
customer_reviews.text: idea is nice, would have loved to see this work out, but it is too complex and not so great instructions.
customer_reviews.author: xander

customer_reviews.title: Looks much grander in the pics; real box and ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks much grander in the pics; real box and packaging looks a bit skimpy. Can't comment on it's play value as it was a secret Santa gift.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Vega

customer_reviews.title: Takes a million years to do one bracelet. Kids ...
customer_reviews.text: Takes a million years to do one bracelet. Kids lose interest 1/4 way through. It works though! Just have to have a very focused patient child.
customer_reviews.author: cz

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as the picture
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my niece and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit and loads of sharing fun.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my granddaughter to give to a neighbor for a birthday and not only the recipient, but all the other girls, loved it! It has lots of materials and is really fun for girls to share.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Nana

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Cheap product, it was for a Christmas gift. I wished I would of just purchased some string and made our own kit.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M. Browning

customer_reviews.title: Consider the age...
customer_reviews.text: Consider the age of the recipient. I was not impressed with this when I received it. It was supposed to be a gift. I ended up purchasing something to go with it as it did not seem like enough. However, the young girl who received it, was very happy when she opened it. I felt pretty silly that I had added to it. It was obvious from her face that it was more than enough. I chose this over some more complicated bracelet kits and I'm very glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Ann

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: I bought for girls activity for sleepover 13-14 yr olds. Somewhat boring for them.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches 28

customer_reviews.title: Bought Bracelet Making Kit for Granddaughter's 6th Birthday
customer_reviews.text: I haven't heard yet whether our granddaughter has used or enjoyed her bracelet kit, but I was impressed with all the kit contained for the price. It seemed to have everything she would need to enjoy supplying all her friends and family with colorful friendship bracelets. The process may be a bit difficult for her to do alone, but she has sisters ages 12 and 14 who can help. I love a gift such as the bracelet kit, one that keeps the play in the child and not in the toy, something creative to stimulate learning and imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H., Phillips

customer_reviews.title: My daughter is having fun with this
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is having fun with this. I use to make these, without a guide thought. Have to go on YouTube to view instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Tons of colors
customer_reviews.text: Tons of colors! Brings me back to my childhood... my daughter is learning but it’s great to do something other than electronics
customer_reviews.author: ANDREA B

customer_reviews.title: Very cute, for older kids only probably.
customer_reviews.text: My 11 year old niece loved this product. She is always wanting to make bracelets and necklaces, any jewelry. The only thing I would pay special attention to is the complexity of the instructions. It was a bit much for an 11 year old, and for some of the designs even I had to re-read it a couple of times. Overall, exactly what I expected and provided about 3 weeks of entertainment during the raining months.
customer_reviews.author: J Thao

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for niece
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my neice. She absolutely loved it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sulaine

customer_reviews.title: Good gift for 9-10 y/o
customer_reviews.text: My niece LOVED this kit, we made bracelets for daaaays....I'm all bracelet-ed out
customer_reviews.author: Loni Kaufmann

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for 8 yr old niece. It is a nice kit. The kit might be suited better for older kids. The instructions could be a more user friendly, I had to read multiple times before I could understand it when trying to help her.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina T.

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my niece and wanted to keep it for myself!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit. It has wonderful little looms for different types of bracelets. One caution: Be careful if your hands are damp or if a kid has anything sticky on their hands because some of the color coding came off one of the foam looms. But it is still worth the purchase, as that problem can easily be remedied with colored Sharpies or other permanent markers. So much fun. I would recommend buying an extra pack of thread because soon everyone will want a bracelet, and it if you're crafty, it can be addictive! Fast shipping...thanks, seller!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine L. O'Neal

customer_reviews.title: Gift for 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: This was a great gift for a 10yo girl. Especially for play therapy/ anxiety / bullying. The craft can be done in a group or solo.
customer_reviews.author: MerMama2020

customer_reviews.title: Great set & value
customer_reviews.text: I bought for a Angel Tree Christmas gift so I'm not sure what the little girl thought of them but from my view it was a good set, had plenty of string & would make this little girl or any child that likes a craft like this plenty of materials to work with. I was happy w/ purchase and sale price.
customer_reviews.author: SLawhon

customer_reviews.title: It works for me.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if the kids used it, but judging the contents, I am happy. Lots to do and make. Take a look and judge for age but would rather get this over a lot of crappy things I could buy at target. Hope this inspires some creative brackets to do with friends.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Taylor

customer_reviews.title: She loved it and her mother loved that she was engaged ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my niece for Christmas and she spent all afternoon working on the bracelets. She said it was kind of hard to figure it out at first, but that the DVD helped a lot. She had to unravel it a few times because she would mess up, but after a while she got the hang of it. She loved it and her mother loved that she was engaged quietly!
customer_reviews.author: Gabby

customer_reviews.title: but wasnt exactly so easy to
customer_reviews.text: it has a lot of stuff, but wasnt exactly so easy to use
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie carrasco

customer_reviews.title: gift for niece
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my niece, she's been making bracelets ever since. Everybody has one now. She loved it.
customer_reviews.author: We Don't Rent Pigs

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: most difficult to do, not intended for a child's ability
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Fama

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my step daughter for Christmas and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Cicilynn29

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Daughter and I to use as a fun throwback activity on a girls night we had recently. She is grown and she used to love making these when she was young. This kit is really great and has everything you need to make great friendship bracelets! We had a blast going back in time and the only drawback is I suggest spending a lot of time on this activity as it is time-consuming and not as easy as it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Complicated without adult help
customer_reviews.text: My daughter, age 9, needed significant adult help, but she enjoyed it and got addicted briefly. She also screwed up the first few times she tried it without adult help -- and she's pretty smart (yeah, I know everyone's kid is a genius, but she's a sharpie even from a non-subjective perspective). Not sure if she's touched it again since the first week, but it's a gift she certainly enjoyed and was intrigued by.
customer_reviews.author: Albert C. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: ) Best craft item I have bought her yet
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 8 year old Granddaughter. Needed a little help getting started then she began to look up youtube videos to help her along. She's made tons of bracelets and has sold them to people for $1 each and has earned nearly $100 toward her IPhone :) Best craft item I have bought her yet.
customer_reviews.author: Heriberto Garcia Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Fun activity!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gift for our daughter's 10th birthday. She loves it! It comes with enough string to get you started but you'll definitely have to visit a craft store to buy more sooner rather than later. The templates are easy to use (even if the directions are slightly complicated) and make bracelets with fun patterns. You can even go online and watch a video on how to use the templates which makes it easier. We highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: N. M. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Slightly complicated to get started but super easy after the first couple of rounds are on
customer_reviews.text: Slightly complicated to get started but super easy after the first couple of rounds are on. The girls love this project for busy work on road trips
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit! My son and I have fun making the bracelets!
customer_reviews.author: Bvergo

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for 10 year old
customer_reviews.text: Bought to gift it, and received many thanks, it was enjoyed and shared by 10 and 12 year old sisters.
customer_reviews.author: mehrdad

customer_reviews.title: Lovely set
customer_reviews.text: For my niece. She’s quite shy and dosnt interact with other children well. This hopefully will give her a reason to interact and make friends
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gift for 8 year old. Hours of entertainment. Good quality. Lots of thread
customer_reviews.author: Catherine brock

customer_reviews.title: Alex Toys Friends 4 Ever Bracelet Making Kit
customer_reviews.text: i love this little kit for friendship bracelets. it came with 2 square disks and 2 wheel disks. it arrived a two weeks before it was supposed to arrive so that was awesome. i first started with the square ones, the instructions were very clear. made 2 bracelets within an hour. then tried the wheel ones, again instructions were clear. understood them in a couple of tries. it also came with embroidery floss which is a bonus because now i dont have to purchase more. overall, im happy with this purchase. best 20 bucks ive ever spent :) i would recommend it to all my friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Elif Ucok

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Creative!
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter wanted a jewelry/bracelet making gift for Christmas. She is a pre-teen and has been having a real good time with her friends coming up with different styles, etc. for creating bracelets. This is a very imaginative item and I recommend it very highly for hours of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: madfleur

customer_reviews.title: Great deal and very nice quality! Easy instructions...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit in a sweet and sturdy box. Includes a lot of supplies, clear instructions, and a bunch of the wheels for making flat and round bracelets. Add a book with more patterns, a pair of scissors, and an extra pack of cotton floss and you're good to go! This was cheaper and better than purchasing the supplies separately.
customer_reviews.author: C. Frederick

customer_reviews.title: She loved it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 9 year old daughter. I made her a bracelet myself before giving it to her. It was not as easy as the videos make it look, of course I am not a child who is well versed in this craft. I love this little company on amazon though. They have so many delightful toy choices that are both fun and educational.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny

customer_reviews.title: Keep busy
customer_reviews.text: Well friends forever?....they were friends till the bracelets ran out
customer_reviews.author: Jayson Bouchard

customer_reviews.title: Friends 4 Ever by ALEX Toys
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a 12 year old family member. Great choice! A good gift to keep a pre-teen occupied and happy. With a trendy craft it's great to learn handcrafts at this age because it opens the door to encouraging confidence in abilities in other crafting areas. A win/win no matter how you look at it.
customer_reviews.author: lmott

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't come with much for instructions. We still haven't made a bracelet....
customer_reviews.author: MN Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Was a very exciting gift that was loved by my 10 year old sister
customer_reviews.author: P876

customer_reviews.title: Fun for kids, adult help may be necessary
customer_reviews.text: This was such a fun idea and perfect for super crafty kiddos. It was fun for boys and girl, aged 6-8. It was something that needed adult help at times though which is why I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: C. Crow

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit but I had to use videos for instruction
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit but I had to use videos for instruction. The written instructions were hard to follow. Great for 8 year old kids but needed a little help.
customer_reviews.author: L Solkey

customer_reviews.title: ...no other string you'll find to suit your needs...
customer_reviews.text: It's string. If you or your children would like to have string, this is the string for you. If you want string in a box, than there's no other string you'll find to suit your needs. However, if you're looking for string, but don't necessarily care for the box, I believe there are cheaper options.
customer_reviews.author: DQPert

customer_reviews.title: Good quality string
customer_reviews.text: My 10 yr. old is very into making string bracelets and I wanted to get her a variety of new strings so I decided to purchase this kit because of the nice variety of colors, the carry case and the 'wheels'. She has an instructional book from a previous purchase that she has been using so she hasn't used the wheels at all so I don't know how they work. She has made a large number of bracelets with the string, and she has been keeping things in the case more or less, so overall, I'm happy with this purchase, as is she.
customer_reviews.author: C. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good kit, not so good instructions
customer_reviews.text: This was a cute kit and had plenty of string and accessories. My daughter liked the colors included and the sturdy carrying case. What we were not a fan of was the instructions. They were bad, we plan on looking at some tutorials online and seeing how those are. The included instructions were not great.
customer_reviews.author: Southernfae

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 10-year old daughter and was really hoping she'd enjoy doing this with her friends. i told her and her mom there were great instructions online, but she never seemed to get into it. i think it was a little too complicated for her. Unfortunately, by the time she was old enough to figure it out, i don't think she'd be interested in doing it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: sonofjohn

customer_reviews.title: Great crafts for kids... Was sent a used product :(
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little kit for any friendship bracelet girl! I bought this for my daughters slumber party tomorrow night. It arrived yesterday. It has been opened, thread has been unwrapped cut, and even a bracelet started! It seems to have just been thrown back in the box sloppily and had no new cardboard packaging. I will not be able to return this after it all gets used tomorrow night, and I'm surprised at Amazon's Primes delivery :(
customer_reviews.author: Kari

customer_reviews.title: For Older Kids
customer_reviews.text: My daughter went to a birthday party where the kids made friendship bracelets using a kit the mother had purchased. She loved it! So I bought this kit thinking it would be similar. The disks are not numbered for the strings, and the instructions are more difficult to follow. My 9 year old got frustrated and put this away without finishing a bracelet. This would be better for a teen.

The patterns use a lot of thread so be prepared to go to the craft store and buy some more embroidery thread if you plan on making a lot of these bracelets. Its a lot of fun, and the bracelets are really strong and durable. Love it!

customer_reviews.title: one happy daughter...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is loving this. She was reluctant to begin, thinking it was too difficult (the written instructions are terrible but the you tube video brings it together). Now well into her second bracelet - she loves it. I like that she can stop and start again without any trouble - she just marks her spot. The array of colors and designs leave room for creativity. I would recommend this kit.

product_meta.title: Alex DIY Friends Forever Bracelet Kit Kids Art and Craft Activity
product_meta.description: ALEX DIY Friends Forever jewelry kit lets young ones make colorful friendship bracelets the easy way. Designed for crafty kids ages eight and up, this kit includes the friendship wheel, a handy tool that simplifies the weaving process so you can make as many bracelets as you have friends. The kit contains 22 different colors of string, beads, needle, and color coded looms that can be used again and again with other string. Everything comes in a take me anywhere suitcase so you can make bracelets on the bus, in the car, at your friend's, and more. Includes 4 color coded looms, 22 colors of embroidery floss (26ft / 8m), beads (0.3oz / 8g), beading needle, instruction book, and carrying case. Recommended for children 8 years of age and older.
feature_bullets: Weave hearts, stripes, diamonds and flowers
Includes 4 color coded looms, 22 colors of embroidery floss, beads, beading needle, instruction book, and carrying case
Recommended for children 8 years of age and older
